{"name":"PHP CRUD operation","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

You need to do this before the test time runs out.

OnlineTest.57:
{"name":"Employee CRUD operation","description":"
Objective: Please create an application of Company and Employee form with CRUD operations using Java. 
 
Description:
   
Below are some guidelines to create the application:
 
1) Create application using Domain Driven Design (DDD) architecuture.     
 
     a) DDD flow will be Domain--->Service(Business logic)--> Repository(Db transactions) ---> Rest API -----> UI
     b) Services will interact with DTO not with Domain
2) Association should be between company and employees.
3) Form should provide the ability to perform CRUD operations on employee and company.
4) You can use the database which ever you are familiar with?(mongo,myql)

 

Hints:
Basic Spring boot application is already up and running.
Notes:
Running the App
At the time machine boots mysql server starts
Open the Eclipse
1. Right click on project select ‘Run As -> Maven clean’
2. Right click on project select ‘Run As -> Maven install’
3. Right click on project select ‘Run As ->Spring Boot Application’
Application will run on 8081 port Open the chrome browser and hit http://localhost:8081/
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

OnlineTest.308:
{"name":"PHP CRUD operation","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.
","hints":"","otherNotes":"","testStatus":"ongoing","environment":"ami-fe427ce8","envId":127,"published":true,"created":"2017-07-02T07:32:46.414Z","updated":"2017-07-02T07:32:46.414Z","duration":45,"category":"php","instanceId":"","enableScreenRecording":true,"isLibraryTest":false,"durationHours":0,"durationMins":45,"envName":"lampp for php CRUD","uid":95,"testLevel":"junior","videoInterviewQuestions":["

Enhance this existing movie finder application by implementing autocomplete in the movie search box.

The application Movie Finder is fully working except the autocomplete feature.

You will need to implement new feature in this existing application.

Do whatever changes you need to do to make this working seamlessly.

You can use any angular directives as per your choice OR you can implement if from scratch.

 

","objective":"Implement autocomplete in movie search box","hints":"

and use it in your autocomplete component.

To  run this app go to Menu -> Run Task  and select npm:start

 

Application will be running on localhost:4200

Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

OnlineTest.442:
{"name":"Game Of Throne Assessment","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters
","objective":"Implement missing feature to complete the whole app.","hints":"","otherNotes":"","environment":"","envId":156,"published":true,"created":"2018-12-26T12:53:32.595Z","updated":"2018-12-29T10:07:52.233Z","duration":90,"category":"angular","instanceId":"","enableScreenRecording":true,"isLibraryTest":false,"durationHours":1,"durationMins":30,"testLevel":"middle","videoInterviewQuestions":["

OnlineTest.443:
{"name":"Ecommerce Assessment","description":"

Ecommerce Assignment.

The project is basic ecommerce app which showcases a basic workflow from Product list to Checkout.

Assignment Details

The following are the tasks which can be set as part of this base assignments.

##Task 1
Title Product Catalog

Read all product information from a sample JSON file and display in Product list page and Product details page.
On clicking on Product list pages product item should redirect to product detail page showing respective products details.

Angular Concepts required: Angular Models, Services, Components, Html Templating, Router

##Task2
Title: Cart Functionality

Enable Cart workflow from dynamic product list page where clicking "Add to cart" of specific product item should add the respective product in the cart.
On clicking on "Remove" button in cart page should remove the respective product item.
The shopping summary should be calculated and shown based on the current product cart items.
On updating the Quantity of the cart line items should update the pricing of shopping summary and price total.
If theres no products in the cart then the cart should show a default message.

Angular Concepts required: Angular Models, Services, Components, Html Templating, Router

##Task3
Title: Checkout workflow

Once clicking on "Checkout" From cart page, the shopping summary should be shown in checkout page.
If theres no product in the cart page then no user should be able to see the checkout page.
All the products from carts should be shown in checkout page too.
A form of Shipping/Billing address should be shown and form validation should be enabled to make sure that all the mandatory fields are entered by the users.
Clicking on "Place Order" button should redirect to Order Confirmation page showing below information:
	-Product line items
	-Shopping summary
	-Shipping/Billing address information.

Angular Concepts required: Services, Components, Html Templating, Router, Authguard

##Task4
Title: Search Autocomplete

On typing on search input box should populate the search autocomplete options.
On clicking on "Search" button should list all the products matching the search term.
The search term should match the title or description or category of product information.

Angular Concepts required: Services, Components, Html Templating, Observables

OnlineTest.446:
{"name":"Materials Login Integration","description":"

Materials Login and Registration

Task1

  • 1.) Implement a custom validator in Angular for checking passwords to haveatleast one uppercase, one lowercase, one digit, one symbol and should be between 7 - 12 characters in length.
  • 2.) Only on login, allow users to redirect to Users page. Implement Angular authguard to have a role check to make sure only authenticated users are accessing Users page else redirect to Access Denied Page.
  • 3.) Implement Pagination logic for users listing page.

Task2

  • 1.) Create a User Registration form which allows users to register new account. Use the same below API which is used for Login. Please refer the documentation: https://reqres.in/
  • 2.) The Registration form should have below form fields:-
    • i.) Email
    • ii.) Full Name
    • iii.) Password
    • iv.) Confirm Password.
  • 3.) Prevent form submission if below validation rules are not satisfied:-
    • i.) Email should be valid.
    • ii.) Full Name should have atleast 5 characters and should not start with a number or symbols.
    • iii.) Password should have atleast one uppercase, one lowercase, one digit, one symbol and should be between 7 - 12 characters in length.
    • iv.) Confirm Password value should be the same as Password field value. Create a custom angular validator to check the mentioned condition.
  • 4.) Show suitable alert messages on form submission status.

OnlineTest.448:
{"name":"News App Assessment","description":"

NewsApp

This project uses https://newsapi.org/docs/endpoints/top-headlines to fetch the top news and list it down.

Task 1

  • Refer /v2/top-headlines of News API to understand the filter mechanism and restrict result listing based on users search query.
  • Complete the search functionality for the search button in the header.
  • On click on the search button, a search panel should slide down with input field. Refer https://material.angular.io/components/input/overview to understand materials component for input field.
  • On click on search, respective search listing should be fetched and displayed in the app.

Task 2

  • On the sidebar, theres multiple news provider source listed.
  • On clicking on any of the source should filter the news listing only to that respective source provider.
  • The selected source providers name should be shown below the header with close button.
  • On clicking on close icon should remove the respective source providers from the filter list.

OnlineTest.461:
{"name":"Ecommerce Assessment","description":"

Ecommerce Assignment.

The project is basic ecommerce app which showcases a basic workflow from Product list to Checkout.

Assignment Details

The following are the tasks which can be set as part of this base assignments.

##Task 1
Title Product Catalog

Read all product information from a sample JSON file and display in Product list page and Product details page.
On clicking on Product list pages product item should redirect to product detail page showing respective products details.

Angular Concepts required: Angular Models, Services, Components, Html Templating, Router

##Task2
Title: Cart Functionality

Enable Cart workflow from dynamic product list page where clicking "Add to cart" of specific product item should add the respective product in the cart.
On clicking on "Remove" button in cart page should remove the respective product item.
The shopping summary should be calculated and shown based on the current product cart items.
On updating the Quantity of the cart line items should update the pricing of shopping summary and price total.
If theres no products in the cart then the cart should show a default message.

Angular Concepts required: Angular Models, Services, Components, Html Templating, Router

##Task3
Title: Checkout workflow

Once clicking on "Checkout" From cart page, the shopping summary should be shown in checkout page.
If theres no product in the cart page then no user should be able to see the checkout page.
All the products from carts should be shown in checkout page too.
A form of Shipping/Billing address should be shown and form validation should be enabled to make sure that all the mandatory fields are entered by the users.
Clicking on "Place Order" button should redirect to Order Confirmation page showing below information:
	-Product line items
	-Shopping summary
	-Shipping/Billing address information.

Angular Concepts required: Services, Components, Html Templating, Router, Authguard

##Task4
Title: Search Autocomplete

On typing on search input box should populate the search autocomplete options.
On clicking on "Search" button should list all the products matching the search term.
The search term should match the title or description or category of product information.

Angular Concepts required: Services, Components, Html Templating, Observables
","objective":"Make the basic ecommerce app working by resolving the tasks mentioned in Problem definitions.","hints":"","otherNotes":"","environment":"","envId":158,"published":true,"created":"2019-01-02T11:06:10.565Z","updated":"2019-01-02T11:06:10.567Z","duration":90,"category":"angular","instanceId":"","enableScreenRecording":true,"isLibraryTest":false,"durationHours":1,"durationMins":30,"testLevel":"middle","videoInterviewQuestions":["

OnlineTest.463:
{"name":"News App Assessment","description":"

NewsApp

This project uses https://newsapi.org/docs/endpoints/top-headlines to fetch the top news and list it down.

Task 1

  • Refer /v2/top-headlines of News API to understand the filter mechanism and restrict result listing based on users search query.
  • Complete the search functionality for the search button in the header.
  • On click on the search button, a search panel should slide down with input field. Refer https://material.angular.io/components/input/overview to understand materials component for input field.
  • On click on search, respective search listing should be fetched and displayed in the app.

Task 2

  • On the sidebar, theres multiple news provider source listed.
  • On clicking on any of the source should filter the news listing only to that respective source provider.
  • The selected source providers name should be shown below the header with close button.
  • On clicking on close icon should remove the respective source providers from the filter list.

{"name":"Pinterest App Assessment","description":"

 

Pinterest App

Currently app mocks a pinterest like screen with cards on screen which on click shows a popup. The popup shows the details of the cards selected along with comments to the respective card article. Fix broken pinterest app.

Task 1

  • Currently on clicking on card a popup appears. However on closing the popup, the screen is blurred and is not user interactive.
  • Fix the issue such as the blurred behavior no longer appears.

Task 2

  • On the header theres a search input box which is static at the moment.
  • Implement the search functionality such that only the articles appears based on the search query entered.

In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

{"name":"Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

Pinterest App

Task 2

  • Implement the search functionality such that only the articles appears based on the search query entered.

OnlineTest.518:
{"name":"Ecommerce Assessment","description":"

Ecommerce Assignment.

The project is basic ecommerce app which showcases a basic workflow from Product list to Checkout.

Assignment Details

The following are the tasks which can be set as part of this base assignments.

##Task 1
Title Product Catalog

Read all product information from a sample JSON file and display in Product list page and Product details page.
On clicking on Product list pages product item should redirect to product detail page showing respective products details.

Angular Concepts required: Angular Models, Services, Components, Html Templating, Router

##Task2
Title: Cart Functionality

Enable Cart workflow from dynamic product list page where clicking "Add to cart" of specific product item should add the respective product in the cart.
On clicking on "Remove" button in cart page should remove the respective product item.
The shopping summary should be calculated and shown based on the current product cart items.
On updating the Quantity of the cart line items should update the pricing of shopping summary and price total.
If theres no products in the cart then the cart should show a default message.

Angular Concepts required: Angular Models, Services, Components, Html Templating, Router

##Task3
Title: Checkout workflow

Once clicking on "Checkout" From cart page, the shopping summary should be shown in checkout page.
If theres no product in the cart page then no user should be able to see the checkout page.
All the products from carts should be shown in checkout page too.
A form of Shipping/Billing address should be shown and form validation should be enabled to make sure that all the mandatory fields are entered by the users.
Clicking on "Place Order" button should redirect to Order Confirmation page showing below information:
	-Product line items
	-Shopping summary
	-Shipping/Billing address information.

Angular Concepts required: Services, Components, Html Templating, Router, Authguard

##Task4
Title: Search Autocomplete

On typing on search input box should populate the search autocomplete options.
On clicking on "Search" button should list all the products matching the search term.
The search term should match the title or description or category of product information.

Angular Concepts required: Services, Components, Html Templating, Observables

{"name":"Materials Login Integration","description":"

Materials Login and Registration

Task1

  • 1.) Implement a custom validator in Angular for checking passwords to haveatleast one uppercase, one lowercase, one digit, one symbol and should be between 7 - 12 characters in length.
  • 2.) Only on login, allow users to redirect to Users page. Implement Angular authguard to have a role check to make sure only authenticated users are accessing Users page else redirect to Access Denied Page.
  • 3.) Implement Pagination logic for users listing page.

Task2

  • 1.) Create a User Registration form which allows users to register new account. Use the same below API which is used for Login. Please refer the documentation: https://reqres.in/
  • 2.) The Registration form should have below form fields:-
    • i.) Email
    • ii.) Full Name
    • iii.) Password
    • iv.) Confirm Password.
  • 3.) Prevent form submission if below validation rules are not satisfied:-
    • i.) Email should be valid.
    • ii.) Full Name should have atleast 5 characters and should not start with a number or symbols.
    • iii.) Password should have atleast one uppercase, one lowercase, one digit, one symbol and should be between 7 - 12 characters in length.
    • iv.) Confirm Password value should be the same as Password field value. Create a custom angular validator to check the mentioned condition.
  • 4.) Show suitable alert messages on form submission status.

NewsApp

This project uses https://newsapi.org/docs/endpoints/top-headlines to fetch the top news and list it down.

Task 1

  • Refer /v2/top-headlines of News API to understand the filter mechanism and restrict result listing based on users search query.
  • Complete the search functionality for the search button in the header.
  • On click on the search button, a search panel should slide down with input field. Refer https://material.angular.io/components/input/overview to understand materials component for input field.
  • On click on search, respective search listing should be fetched and displayed in the app.

Task 2

  • On the sidebar, theres multiple news provider source listed.
  • On clicking on any of the source should filter the news listing only to that respective source provider.
  • The selected source providers name should be shown below the header with close button.
  • On clicking on close icon should remove the respective source providers from the filter list.

{"name":"Demo Test: PHP CRUD Test","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

{"name":"Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"Demo Test: Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"PHP CRUD Test","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"Demo Test: Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

Eg: If the user types an invalid email address, the corresponding error should be displayed as soon as the user shifts control from the email field.

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.

  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"PHP CRUD Test","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"PHP CRUD Test","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

{"name":"Demo Test: Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"PHP CRUD Test","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

{"name":"Demo Test: Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"PHP CRUD Test","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

Please implement the following two requirements:

1. Fix the popup issue:

In /upcoming shows the list of movies where every item has show details link.

clicking on it should open the popup with movie details.

For some reason this is not working.

Your goal is to fix this issue.

2: Implement autocomplates in serach box

Enhance this existing movie finder application by implementing autocomplete in the movie search box.

The application Movie Finder is fully working except the autocomplete feature.

You will need to implement new feature in this existing application.

Do whatever changes you need to do to make this working seamlessly.

You can use any angular directives as per your choice OR you can implement if from scratch.

 

","objective":"Implement autocomplete in movie search box and fix the popup","hints":"

Angular Material: Autocomplete

https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete

","otherNotes":"

and use it in your autocomplete component.

To  run this app go to Menu -> Run Task  and select npm:start

 

Application will be running on localhost:4200

{"name":"Demo Test: Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

This webapp has a typical Signup / SignIn page for users to sign up and login.
Once logged in, users can see a simple Home page and an Account page.
The Sign Up page has only the following fields currently:
1. Full Name
2. Email
3. Password
4. Confirm Password

TODO:
Add these additional fields to the Sign Up form and Account page:
1. Date of Birth (add validations for mm/dd/yyyy format too)
2. LinkedIn URL (add validations for valid web url too)

These fields should be mandatory during signup. User can then update them via the Account page.

{"name":"MovieFinder Autocomplete (Web)","description":"

Please implement the following two requirements:

1. Fix the popup issue:

In /upcoming shows the list of movies where every item has show details link.

clicking on it should open the popup with movie details.

For some reason this is not working.

Your goal is to fix this issue.

2: Implement autocomplates in serach box

Enhance this existing movie finder application by implementing autocomplete in the movie search box.

The application Movie Finder is fully working except the autocomplete feature.

You will need to implement new feature in this existing application.

Do whatever changes you need to do to make this working seamlessly.

You can use any angular directives as per your choice OR you can implement if from scratch.

 

","objective":"Implement autocomplete in movie search box and fix the popup","hints":"

Angular Material: Autocomplete

https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete

","otherNotes":"

Movie search API is already integrated in this app. You will just need to find out in the services

and use it in your autocomplete component.

This application uses Visual Studio Code as the development environment.

To  run this app go to Menu -> Run Task  and select npm:start

 

Application will be running on localhost:4200

{"name":"Game Of Throne Assessment V1","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

3. Add a \"search tweet\" filter on the top of the page - so that the user can search tweets by keyword.

OnlineTest.734:
{"name":"MovieFinder Autocomplete (Web)","description":"

Please implement the following two requirements:

1. Fix the popup issue:

In /upcoming shows the list of movies where every item has show details link.

clicking on it should open the popup with movie details.

For some reason this is not working.

Your goal is to fix this issue.

2: Implement autocomplates in serach box

Enhance this existing movie finder application by implementing autocomplete in the movie search box.

The application Movie Finder is fully working except the autocomplete feature.

You will need to implement new feature in this existing application.

Do whatever changes you need to do to make this working seamlessly.

You can use any angular directives as per your choice OR you can implement if from scratch.

 

","objective":"Implement autocomplete in movie search box and fix the popup","hints":"

Angular Material: Autocomplete

https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete

","otherNotes":"

Movie search API is already integrated in this app. You will just need to find out in the services

and use it in your autocomplete component.

This application uses Visual Studio Code as the development environment.

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

{"name":"Game Of Throne Assessment V40","description":"

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

GamesOfThrones

The project was built using the backend API: https://anapioficeandfire.com. Below is the existing status of the project:-

  •  Integrate the backend API and Show data in front end.
  •  Implement search functionality for easy access to Houses.
  •  Implement a new Characters page to show and list all characters with search filters name, deadOrAlive

##Task1

  • Currently the project lacks search functionality to filter houses by search functionality.
  • Refer https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#houses to alter the API service implementation to include search queries.
  • The final implementation should have a search functionality implemented which allows user to search houses by their names.

##Task2

  • Create a new page under the route /characters.
  • List all the characters with similiar appeareance as in /home page.
  • Implement Search functionality which allows users to search characters by Name, isDead.
  • Use the API mentioned in the documentation:https://anapioficeandfire.com/Documentation#characters

Please implement the following two requirements:

1. Fix the popup issue:

In /upcoming shows the list of movies where every item has show details link.

clicking on it should open the popup with movie details.

For some reason this is not working.

Your goal is to fix this issue.

2: Implement autocomplates in serach box

Enhance this existing movie finder application by implementing autocomplete in the movie search box.

The application Movie Finder is fully working except the autocomplete feature.

You will need to implement new feature in this existing application.

Do whatever changes you need to do to make this working seamlessly.

You can use any angular directives as per your choice OR you can implement if from scratch.

 

","objective":"Implement autocomplete in movie search box and fix the popup","hints":"

","otherNotes":"

and use it in your autocomplete component.

This application uses Visual Studio Code as the development environment.

To  run this app go to Menu -> Run Task  and select npm:start

 

Application will be running on localhost:4200

{"name":"PHP CRUD operation","description":"
Test type: PHP Test (junior level)
 
Objective: Add the Delete functionality to an existing CRUD application
 
Description:
In this test, you will be given a basic CRUD application (CRUD = Create/Read/Update/Delete). You can see its code and run it too.
The app stores & displays simple details of the user (First Name, Last Name, City). The necessary database and its tables are pre-configured and working too.
You can currently view, add and update records in this webapp.
However the Delete functionality is missing.
Your job is to add the missing Delete functionality.
You need to do this before the test time runs out.
 
Hints:
The delete icon is already in place.
Find out where it is being referred to in the code and write your code there.
 
Other notes:
1. You need to RDP into the host machine to do this test.
2. Once done, click Finish Test on the test dashboard.

{"name":"TensorFlow Object Detection","description":"

Detect multiple objects within an image, with bounding boxes. Recognize 80 different classes of objects.

Detect multiple objects within an image, with bounding boxes. Recognize 80 different classes of objects.

Detect multiple objects within an image, with bounding boxes. Recognize 80 different classes of objects.

","objective":"Detect multiple objects within an image, with bounding boxes. Recognize 80 different classes of objects.","hints":"

An object detection model is trained to detect the presence and location of multiple classes of objects. For example, a model might be trained with images that contain various pieces of fruit, along with a label that specifies the class of fruit they represent (e.g. an apple, a banana, or a strawberry), and data specifying where each object appears in the image.

When we subsequently provide an image to the model, it will output a list of the objects it detects, the location of a bounding box that contains each object, and a score that indicates the confidence that detection was correct.

Detect multiple objects within an image, with bounding boxes. Recognize 80 different classes of objects.

","objective":"Detect multiple objects within an image, with bounding boxes. Recognize 80 different classes of objects.","hints":"

An object detection model is trained to detect the presence and location of multiple classes of objects. For example, a model might be trained with images that contain various pieces of fruit, along with a label that specifies the class of fruit they represent (e.g. an apple, a banana, or a strawberry), and data specifying where each object appears in the image.

When we subsequently provide an image to the model, it will output a list of the objects it detects, the location of a bounding box that contains each object, and a score that indicates the confidence that detection was correct.
